DataElement.preferredName: Other Behavior Management Intervention or Procedure Additional Training and Education Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._human or animal activity studied in terms of motivation, direction, result, emotion, perception, or etiology._The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary)_To teach theory and hands on experience_the free text field to specify the assessment performed.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Property.preferredName: Behavior Management Intervention or Procedure Additional Training and Education
Property.preferredDefinition: human or animal activity studied in terms of motivation, direction, result, emotion, perception, or etiology.:The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Added; extra. Concepts.definition: The actions or reactions of an object or organism, usually in relation to the environment or surrounding world of stimuli.
The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
To teach theory and hands on experience

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
